statements.name: PROC DOCUMENT
statements.description: Creates or opens a document to modify.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of a new or existing document and its access mode.

arguments.name: <libref.>member-name
arguments.description: identifies a new or existing ODS document.

arguments.name: READ
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Read-Only access.

arguments.name: UPDATE
arguments.description: opens an ODS document and appends new content to the document. UPDATE provides Update access as well as Read access. UPDATE is the default access setting.

arguments.name: WRITE
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Read and Write access.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: assigns a label to a document.

statements.name: COPY
statements.description: Copies an entry into the specified path.

arguments.name: TO
arguments.description: specifies the path. You can have multiple TO arguments.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: is the location where a link, output object, or file is copied.

arguments.name: (WHERE=())
arguments.description: conditionally selects a subset of entries in an ODS document.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as a date literal, a value, or a BY variable value.

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: returns a value from a computation or system manipulation.

arguments.name: subsetting
arguments.description: is a special type of WHERE expression operand used by the DOCUMENT procedure to help you find common values in ODS documents.

arguments.name: _CDATE_
arguments.description: is the creation date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the creation datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CTIME_
arguments.description: is the creation time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the path to the label of the current entry. Document label paths are formed by concatenating the labels and sequence numbers, and then separating them with the forward slash (/) symbol.

arguments.name: _MAX_
arguments.description: is the last observation.

arguments.name: _MDATE_
arguments.description: is the modification date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the modification datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MIN_
arguments.description: is the first observation.

arguments.name: _MTIME_
arguments.description: is the modification time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the current entry.

arguments.name: _OBS_
arguments.description: is the current observation number in an output object.

arguments.name: observation-number
arguments.description: is the observation number to be replayed.

arguments.name: observation-variable
arguments.description: is the name of an observation.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the path of the current entry.

arguments.name: _SEQNO_
arguments.description: is the sequence number of the current entry.

arguments.name: _TYPE_
arguments.description: is the type of the current entry.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: is the name of a BY variable.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares one variable with a value or another variable.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: inserts a copy of an entry after the specified path.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: inserts a copy of an entry before the specified path.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: inserts a copy of an entry at the beginning of the specified directory.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: inserts a copy of an entry at the end of the specified directory.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of levels that you want to copy.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies all levels.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the numeric value of the path level.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes entries from the current directory.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of one or more links, output objects, or directories.

arguments.name: (WHERE=())
arguments.description: conditionally selects a subset of entries in an ODS document.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as a date literal, a value, or a BY variable value.

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: returns a value from a computation or system manipulation.

arguments.name: subsetting
arguments.description: is a special type of WHERE expression operand used by the DOCUMENT procedure to help you find common values in ODS documents.

arguments.name: _CDATE_
arguments.description: is the creation date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the creation datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CTIME_
arguments.description: is the creation time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the path to the label of the current entry. Document label paths are formed by concatenating the labels and sequence numbers, and then separating them with the forward slash (/) symbol.

arguments.name: _MAX_
arguments.description: is the last observation.

arguments.name: _MDATE_
arguments.description: is the modification date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the modification datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MIN_
arguments.description: is the first observation.

arguments.name: _MTIME_
arguments.description: is the modification time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the current entry.

arguments.name: _OBS_
arguments.description: is the current observation number in an output object.

arguments.name: observation-number
arguments.description: is the observation number to be replayed.

arguments.name: observation-variable
arguments.description: is the name of an observation.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the path of the current entry.

arguments.name: _SEQNO_
arguments.description: is the sequence number of the current entry.

arguments.name: _TYPE_
arguments.description: is the type of the current entry.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: is the name of a BY variable.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares one variable with a value or another variable.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of levels that you want to delete.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies all levels.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the numeric value of the path level.

statements.name: DIR
statements.description: Sets or displays the current directory.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: sets the current directory.

statements.name: DOC
statements.description: Opens a document and its contents to browse or edit.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: assigns a label to a document.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: specifies that only the documents in the specified library-name are listed.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name that you assign to a document and its access mode.

arguments.name: <libref.>member-name
arguments.description: identifies a document.

arguments.name: READ
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Read-Only access.

arguments.name: WRITE
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Write access, but only if you have Write permission.

arguments.name: UPDATE
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Update access, but only if you have Update permission.

statements.name: DOC CLOSE
statements.description: Closes the current document.

statements.name: HIDE
statements.description: Prevents output from being displayed when the document is replayed.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of the file or files that you want to hide.

statements.name: IMPORT
statements.description: Imports the specified SAS data set or graph segment to the specified path.

arguments.name: TO
arguments.description: specifies the import location. You can specify multiple TO arguments.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies an existing SAS data set that you want to import.

arguments.name: GRSEG=
arguments.description: stores a reference to a graph segment.

arguments.name: grseg
arguments.description: specifies the 3-level catalog pathname (for example, GRSEG=Sasuser.grseg.mygraph).

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location where you want to import the data set or graph segment.

arguments.name: TEXTFILE=
arguments.description: imports a text file into an ODS document that can be replayed to open ODS destinations.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: specifies the filename. filename can be a listing file, a SAS program, or any other text file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: data-set-options
arguments.description: specify actions that apply only to the SAS data set.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: imports the data set or graph segment into the directory after the specified path.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: imports the data set or graph segment into the directory before the specified path.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: imports the data set or graph segment at the beginning of the directory.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: imports the data set or graph segment at the end the directory.

statements.name: LINK
statements.description: Creates a symbolic link from one specified entry to another specified entry.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the locations of the entries that you want to link to one another.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: links to the entry that follows the specified path in the current directory.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: links to the entry that precedes the specified path in the current directory.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: links to the first entry in the current directory.

arguments.name: HARD
arguments.description: specifies a type of link that refers to a copy of an output object within the ODS document. All data is shared between the link and the target, except names and labels.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: copies the source label to the link.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: links to the last entry in the current directory.

statements.name: LIST
statements.description: Lists the contents of one or more entries.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of an entry. An entry can be one or more directories, links, or output objects.

arguments.name: (WHERE=())
arguments.description: conditionally selects a subset of entries in an ODS document.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as a date literal, a value, or a BY variable value.

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: returns a value from a computation or system manipulation.

arguments.name: subsetting
arguments.description: is a special type of WHERE expression operand used by the DOCUMENT procedure to help you find common values in ODS documents.

arguments.name: _CDATE_
arguments.description: is the creation date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the creation datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CTIME_
arguments.description: is the creation time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the path to the label of the current entry. Document label paths are formed by concatenating the labels and sequence numbers, and then separating them with the forward slash (/) symbol.

arguments.name: _MAX_
arguments.description: is the last observation.

arguments.name: _MDATE_
arguments.description: is the modification date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the modification datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MIN_
arguments.description: is the first observation.

arguments.name: _MTIME_
arguments.description: is the modification time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the current entry.

arguments.name: _OBS_
arguments.description: is the current observation number in an output object.

arguments.name: observation-number
arguments.description: is the observation number to be replayed.

arguments.name: observation-variable
arguments.description: is the name of an observation.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the path of the current entry.

arguments.name: _SEQNO_
arguments.description: is the sequence number of the current entry.

arguments.name: _TYPE_
arguments.description: is the type of the current entry.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: is the name of a BY variable.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares one variable with a value or another variable.

arguments.name: BYGROUPS
arguments.description: creates, in the entry list, columns for BY variables. The name of the BY variable becomes the column name. The values of the BY variables are listed in the columns.

arguments.name: DETAILS
arguments.description: specifies the properties of the entries.

arguments.name: FOLLOW
arguments.description: resolves all links and lists the contents of the entries.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of levels that you want to list.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies all levels.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the numeric value of the path level.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order in which the entries are listed.

arguments.name: ALPHA
arguments.description: lists the entries in alphabetical order.

arguments.name: DATE
arguments.description: lists the directories in ascending order based on the date and time the files were created.

arguments.name: INSERT
arguments.description: lists the directories in the order in which the entries were inserted.

statements.name: MAKE
statements.description: Creates one or more new directories.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the newly created directory.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: adds the newly created directory after the specified path in the current directory.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: adds the newly created directory before the specified path in the current directory.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: adds the newly created directory to the beginning of the current directory.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: adds the newly created directory to the end of the current directory.

statements.name: MOVE
statements.description: Moves entries from the specified location to another location.

arguments.name: TO
arguments.description: specifies the new path.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of links, output objects, or files that you want to move.

arguments.name: (WHERE=())
arguments.description: conditionally selects a subset of entries in an ODS document.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as a date literal, a value, or a BY variable value.

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: returns a value from a computation or system manipulation.

arguments.name: subsetting
arguments.description: is a special type of WHERE expression operand used by the DOCUMENT procedure to help you find common values in ODS documents.

arguments.name: _CDATE_
arguments.description: is the creation date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the creation datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CTIME_
arguments.description: is the creation time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the path to the label of the current entry. Document label paths are formed by concatenating the labels and sequence numbers, and then separating them with the forward slash (/) symbol.

arguments.name: _MAX_
arguments.description: is the last observation.

arguments.name: _MDATE_
arguments.description: is the modification date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the modification datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MIN_
arguments.description: is the first observation.

arguments.name: _MTIME_
arguments.description: is the modification time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the current entry.

arguments.name: _OBS_
arguments.description: is the current observation number in an output object.

arguments.name: observation-number
arguments.description: is the observation number to be replayed.

arguments.name: observation-variable
arguments.description: is the name of an observation.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the path of the current entry.

arguments.name: _SEQNO_
arguments.description: is the sequence number of the current entry.

arguments.name: _TYPE_
arguments.description: is the type of the current entry.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: is the name of a BY variable.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares one variable with a value or another variable.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: moves the entry after the specified entry in the path.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: moves the entry before the specified entry in the path.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: moves the entry to the beginning of the specified directory.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: moves the entry to the end of the specified directory.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of levels that you want to move.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies all levels.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the numeric value of the path level.

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Creates text strings in the current directory.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location where the note is stored.

arguments.name: 'text'
arguments.description: specifies the text string. If no text string is specified, then the NOTE statement creates a blank note.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: inserts the text string after the specified path.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: inserts the text string before the specified path.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: inserts the text string at the beginning of the directory.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: inserts the text string at the end of the directory.

arguments.name: JUST=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text string with the left margin.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: centers the text string between the left and right margins.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text string with the right margin.

statements.name: OBANOTE
statements.description: Creates or modifies an object footer (lines of text) after the specified output object.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the name of the ODS output object.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the relative line that contains the object footer.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: specifies that a table containing the output object’s heading is written to active destinations.

arguments.name: 'text'
arguments.description: specifies the text string that becomes the object footer.

arguments.name: JUST=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the object footer.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the object footer with the left margin.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: centers the object footer between the left and right margins.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the object footer with the right margin.

statements.name: OBBNOTE
statements.description: Creates or modifies an object heading (lines of text) before the output object.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the name of the ODS output object.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the relative line that contains the object heading.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: specifies that a table containing the output object’s footers is written to active destinations.

arguments.name: 'text'
arguments.description: specifies the text string that becomes the object heading.

arguments.name: JUST=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the object heading.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the object heading with the left margin.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: centers the object heading between the left and right margins.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the object heading with the right margin.

statements.name: OBDYNAM
statements.description: Prints a table of dynamic values for the specified output object.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the ODS output object.

statements.name: OBFOOTN
statements.description: Creates or modifies lines of text at the bottom of the page on which the output object is displayed.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the ODS output object.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the relative line that contains the footnote.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: specifies that a table containing the output object’s footnotes is written to active destinations.

arguments.name: 'text'
arguments.description: specifies the text string that becomes the footnote.

statements.name: OBPAGE
statements.description: Creates or deletes a page break for an output object.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output object.

arguments.name: AFTER
arguments.description: inserts a page break after an output object.

arguments.name: DELETE
arguments.description: removes the page break for an output object.

statements.name: OBSTITLE
statements.description: Create or modify subtitles.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the ODS output object.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the relative line that contains the subtitle.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: specifies that a table containing the output object’s subtitles is written to active destinations.

arguments.name: 'text'
arguments.description: specifies the text string.

arguments.name: JUST=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text string with the left margin.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text string in the center between the left and right margins.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text string with the right margin.

statements.name: OBTEMPL
statements.description: Writes, to any open ODS destination, the source code of the ODS template, if any, that is associated with the specified output object.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of the output object.

statements.name: OBTITLE
statements.description: Creates or modifies title lines for the output.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output object.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the relative line that contains the title.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: specifies that a table containing the output object’s titles is written to active destinations.

arguments.name: 'text'
arguments.description: specifies the text string.

statements.name: RENAME
statements.description: Renames an entry.

arguments.name: TO
arguments.description: specifies the new name of an entry.

arguments.name: path-1
arguments.description: specifies the current directory or output object.

arguments.name: path-2
arguments.description: specifies the new name of the directory or output object.

statements.name: REPLAY
statements.description: Displays one or more entries to the specified open ODS destination(s).

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of an entry. An entry can be one or more directories, links, or output objects.

arguments.name: (WHERE=())
arguments.description: conditionally selects a subset of entries in an ODS document.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a fixed value such as a date literal, a value, or a BY variable value.

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: returns a value from a computation or system manipulation.

arguments.name: subsetting
arguments.description: is a special type of WHERE expression operand used by the DOCUMENT procedure to help you find common values in ODS documents.

arguments.name: _CDATE_
arguments.description: is the creation date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the creation datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _CTIME_
arguments.description: is the creation time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the current entry.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the path to the label of the current entry. Document label paths are formed by concatenating the labels and sequence numbers, and then separating them with the forward slash (/) symbol.

arguments.name: _MAX_
arguments.description: is the last observation.

arguments.name: _MDATE_
arguments.description: is the modification date of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MDATETIME_
arguments.description: is the modification datetime of the current entry.

arguments.name: _MIN_
arguments.description: is the first observation.

arguments.name: _MTIME_
arguments.description: is the modification time of the current entry.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the current entry.

arguments.name: _OBS_
arguments.description: is the current observation number in an output object.

arguments.name: observation-number
arguments.description: is the observation number to be replayed.

arguments.name: observation-variable
arguments.description: is the name of an observation.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the path of the current entry.

arguments.name: _SEQNO_
arguments.description: is the sequence number of the current entry.

arguments.name: _TYPE_
arguments.description: is the type of the current entry.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: is the name of a BY variable.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares one variable with a value or another variable.

arguments.name: ACTIVEFOOTN
arguments.description: specifies that footnotes that are active in a SAS session override the footnotes that are stored in an ODS document.

arguments.name: ACTIVETITLE
arguments.description: specifies that titles that are active in a SAS session override the titles that are stored in an ODS document.

arguments.name: ANCESTORS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of parent directories to replay.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the number of parent directories to replay. n must be a nonnegative integer.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that all directories are replayed.

arguments.name: DEST=
arguments.description: specifies one or more ODS destinations to display the output objects.

arguments.name: DYNAMDATA=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the data set that contains the dynamic values.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of levels that you want to replay.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that all levels of the directory are displayed to all open destinations.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the numeric value of the path level.

arguments.name: STORE=
arguments.description: specifies the template store when replaying output objects from the path. If the replayed path is an output object, the template store applies only to that output object. If the path is a directory, the template store applies to any output objects contained within the directory.

statements.name: SETLABEL
statements.description: Assigns a label to the specified path.

arguments.name: 'label'
arguments.description: specifies the text of the label. You can customize labels by inserting BY variable values (#BYVAL), BY variable names (#BYVAR), or BY lines (#BYLINE) into labels that are specified in PROC DOCUMENT steps.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of a link, output object, or directory.

statements.name: UNHIDE
statements.description: Enables the output of a hidden entry to be displayed when it is replayed.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: specifies the location of a link, output object, or file.
